titles.title: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2013
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2013
A bill to authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 418.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
9/9/2014--Passed Senate without amendment. Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2013 - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to offer to convey to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation certain federal lands located in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
Requires such conveyance to be in accordance with a fair market value appraisal that is acceptable to the Administrator.
Makes the Foundation responsible for the costs related to such conveyance.
Requires the conveyance to occur within three years of this Act's enactment.
